description: As the title says. Tried changing the docker sock location because its not at the default location and it doesnt take the new location. Moving the file is also not an option.
summary: This does not work on Fedora 37

description:
Despite having functional docker containers working without root, the app insists docker still needs root and does not work.

I hope this can get fixed as some stage.
It was designed for elementaryOS and because of that it looks really out of place on a regular GNOME desktop. The dialogs/popups are strange and the UI buttons are out of place as well.
summary: Doesn't fit in well on non-elementaryOS

description: Nothing spectacular, it does what it's supposed to do

This software does not work out of the box. You need to install Flatseal, and enable access to "All system files (filesystem=host)".
If you use Docker Desktop, you would also need to change the sock directory to "/home/[USER]/.docker/desktop/docker.sock"
summary: It does not work out of the box
